panels.title: max_concurrent_inferences: Maximum number of concurrent inferences to a large language model
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case
Maximum number of concurrent inferences to a large language model

panels.content:
The maximum number of inferences (requests) we can concurrently make to a
single LLM.

Anthropic is enforcing different concurrency limits per model they provide.
When we make a new request when we already have the maximum number of concurrent
requests in flight, Anthropic responds with a 429. The client-library in the
AI-gateway is set to retry once on errors.

When Anthropic rejects the requests, this leads to a 500 error in the AI-gateway
and Workhorse. This results in clients not getting a response (code suggestion).

To fix this, we need to request a larger concurrency to Anthropic.
Currently in the `#ext-anthropic` slack channel.

Bear in mind that this metric is sampled at scrape time. So it is only an
approximation of the actual number of requests in flight. We should assume the
actual utilization is higher and request increases sooner.

panels.title: max_concurrent_inferences_per_engine: Maximum number of concurrent inferences to a large language model
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case
Maximum number of concurrent inferences to a large language model

panels.content:
The maximum number of inferences (requests) we can concurrently make to a
all models for a single provider (engine).

Anthropic is enforcing different concurrency limits per model they provide.
But across all models, we can not exceed the global limit that is equal to
the largest allowed limit.

When Anthropic rejects the requests, this leads to a 500 error in the AI-gateway
and Workhorse. This results in clients not getting a response (code suggestion).

To fix this, we need to request a larger concurrency to Anthropic.
Currently in the `#ext-anthropic` slack channel.

Bear in mind that this metric is sampled at scrape time. So it is only an
approximation of the actual number of requests in flight. We should assume the
actual utilization is higher and request increases sooner.

panels.title: gcp_quota_limit_vertex_ai: GCP Quota utilization per environment
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case

panels.content:
GCP Quota utilization / limit ratio for all vertex AI models except code-gecko.

Saturation on the quota may cause problems with the requests.

To fix, we can request a quota increase for the specific resource to the GCP support team.

panels.title: gcp_quota_limit_vertex_ai_code_gecko: GCP Quota utilization per environment
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case

panels.content:
GCP Quota utilization / limit ratio for Vertex AI for code-gecko model (used by code completion part of Code Suggestions)

Saturation on the quota may cause problems with code completion requests.

To fix, we can request a quota increase for the specific resource to the GCP support team.

panels.title: open_fds: Open file descriptor utilization per instance
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case
Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.content:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.

panels.title: Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case

panels.content:
Container CPU utilization of the Runway service distributed across all container instances.

For scaling, refer to https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/services/cpu.

Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case

For scaling, refer to https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/max-instances.

Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case

For scaling, refer to https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/services/memory-limits.

panels.title: Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case

panels.content:
Max number of concurrent requests being served by each container instance of the Runway service.

For scaling, refer to https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/concurrency.
